alert.note: Alert for Laramie; Platte (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 22 at 4:33PM MDT until June 22 at 4:45PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL LARAMIE AND SOUTHEASTERN PLATTE COUNTIES... At 433 PM MDT, a confirmed tornado was located south of Chugwater, or 27 miles south of Wheatland, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Laramie and southeastern Platte Counties. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 43 and 53. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Motorists should not take shelter under highway overpasses. If you cannot safely drive away from the tornado, as a last resort, either park your vehicle and stay put, or abandon your vehicle and lie down in a low lying area and protect yourself from flying debris.
